name: vl_sql
description:
The script uses some connection settings to get a list of tables.
Then it gets the current sql command which is separated either by ; or by newlines from other sql commands. It gets a list of field names of all tables occuring within the command.
Based on those tables it generates the completion list by getting data db scheme information from database.
If there are any aliases such as "`foo` as f" and you start completion after
f. only the fields from that table will be listed.
Before AS or after FROM only the list of tables is used.

Of course you can also execute the current command by defining a mapping such as
  nnoremap <buffer> <F2> :echo b:db_conn.query(join(vl#dev#sql#sql#ThisCommand(),"\n"))<cr>

However this should be done the way dbext.vim does it (TODO)
install_details:
Unzip the and source the .vim installer file.
It will ask you where to install the script and ask for confirmaiton before taking any action. It will tell you about files which will be overridden if any.
Use the following commands to get started:

call vl#dev#sql#sql#Connect('mysql', {'user':'root', 'password' :'pwd'})
setlocal omnifunc=vl#dev#sql#sql#Complete

Look the other configuration settings up in autoload/vl/dev/sql/sql.vim file

asterisks (*) are not yet quoted correctly. This matters if this char appears in your password.
You should just add a* to autoload/vl/lib/system/system.vim line 30 so that it looks like this:
let cmd .=  ' '.escape(a, "* '\"\\`")  "thanks nottha_k for finding this issue


Contact me if you have any suggestions, feedback, patches or encounter any problems.
